page.title: 12DALRY COMMUNITY COUNCIL
page.content: The first Council was elected in 1978. Among early concerns was the loss of public services,like the High School, Police Station, Registrar's Office and Employment Exchange. To combat problems of gap sites and dereliction, the Council organised a massive clean-up, helped by the youth organisations. The S.D.A. then began improving the town. Inviting the Countryside Commission, to take part, sparked off the Lynn Glen Project. Improvements are being made in roads and traffic safety. A recent campaign succeeded in saving the Post Office. Problems still unsolved are vandalism and poor public transport. Townspeople can attend meetings but they rarely do. The town needs a newsletter to spread information, and the Council needs enthusiastic young people to stand for election.
